channel.title: List of Secure Computation Papers
channel.description: A list of papers on IACR eprint on the topic of secure computation.

item.title: Highly Efficient and Reusable Private Function Evaluation with Linear Complexity
item.description: Osman Bicer and Muhammed Ali Bingol and Mehmet Sabir Kiraz

item.title: Secure Two-Party Computation over Unreliable Channels
item.description: Ran Gelles and Anat Paskin-Cherniavsky and Vassilis Zikas

item.title: Computer-aided proofs for multiparty computation with active security
item.description: Helene Haagh and Aleksandr Karbyshev and Sabine Oechsner and Bas Spitters and Pierre-Yves Strub

item.title: Secure Two-party Threshold ECDSA from ECDSA Assumptions
item.description: Jack Doerner and Yashvanth Kondi and Eysa Lee and abhi shelat

item.title: Efficient Delegated Private Set Intersection on Outsourced Private Datasets
item.description: Aydin Abadi and Sotirios Terzis and Roberto Metere and Changyu Dong

item.title: Approximating Private Set Union/Intersection Cardinality with Logarithmic Complexity
item.description: Changyu Dong and Grigorios Loukides

item.title: Pushing the Communication Barrier in Secure Computation using Lookup Tables
item.description: Ghada Dessouky and Farinaz Koushanfar and Ahmad-Reza Sadeghi and Thomas Schneider and Shaza Zeitouni and Michael Zohner

item.title: SPDZ2k: Efficient MPC mod 2^k for Dishonest Majority
item.description: Ronald Cramer and Ivan Damgård and Daniel Escudero and Peter Scholl and Chaoping Xing

item.title: On the Exact Round Complexity of Secure Three-Party Computation
item.description: Arpita Patra and Divya Ravi

item.title: Minimising Communication in Honest-Majority MPC by Batchwise Multiplication Verification
item.description: Peter Sebastian Nordholt and Meilof Veeningen

item.title: Secure Multi-Party Computation from Strongly Uniform Key Agreement
item.description: Daniele Friolo and Daniel Masny and Daniele Venturi

item.title: Efficient Range ORAM with $\mathbb{O}(\log^{2}{N})$ Locality
item.description: Anrin Chakraborti and Adam J. Aviv and Seung Geol Choi and Travis Mayberry and Daniel S. Roche and Radu Sion

item.title: The Usefulness of Sparsifiable Inputs: How to Avoid Subexponential iO
item.description: Thomas Agrikola and Geoffroy Couteau and Dennis Hofheinz

item.title: Error-Detecting in Monotone Span Programs with Application to Communication Efficient Multi-Party Computation
item.description: Nigel P. Smart and Tim Wood

item.title: A Note on the Communication Complexity of Multiparty Computation in the Correlated Randomness Model
item.description: Geoffroy Couteau

item.title: Logistic regression over encrypted data from fully homomorphic encryption

item.title: Founding Cryptography on Smooth Projective Hashing

item.title: SecureNN: Efficient and Private Neural Network Training
